title: Ashurst poaches DLA Piper partner
text:
Law firm Ashurst has bolstered its global disputes practice, luring DLA Piper partner Rani John.

John spent four years at DLA Piper as head of its Sydney disputes team, specialising in commercial dispute resolution and advice work for banking and corporate clients across a range of regulatory investigations and proceedings.

Prior to DLA Piper, John had a 14-year stint at Gilbert + Tobin, the last 11 of which she was a partner.

Ashurst head of dispute resolution, APAC, Mark Elvy noted John's "strong personal reputation in the anti-bribery and corruption/investigations field," and said her experience "aligns with our strengths, strategy and desire for further growth in this area."

"Regulatory investigations and enforcement has been a particular focus of my practice over a number of years, an area in which Ashurst is very strong," John told Street Talk.
description: Law firm Ashurst has bolstered its global disputes practice in Sydney, luring DLA Piper partner Rani John.
